member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.AddAMMResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Adds one or more tags to the specified resource.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
The tags to add to the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.AddAMMResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.AddAMMResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.AddAMMResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationCmdlet
member.summary: Describes the details of a specific application.

para.para: The identifier of the application.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.GetApplicationResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.GetApplicationResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists the applications associated with a specific Amazon Web Services account. You can provide the unique identifier of a specific environment in a query parameter to see all applications associated with that environment.

para.para: The unique identifier of the runtime environment where the applications are deployed.
The names of the applications.
The maximum number of applications to return.
A pagination token to control the number of applications displayed in the list.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Applications'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.ListApplicationsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.ListApplicationsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the EnvironmentId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^EnvironmentId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationVersionCmdlet
member.summary: Returns details about a specific version of a specific application.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application.
The specific version of the application.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationVersionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.GetApplicationVersionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.GetApplicationVersionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationVersionCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationVersionListCmdlet
member.summary: Returns a list of the application versions for a specific application.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application.
The maximum number of application versions to return.
A pagination token returned from a previous call to this operation. This specifies the next item to return. To return to the beginning of the list, exclude this parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationVersionListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ApplicationVersions'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.ListApplicationVersionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.ListApplicationVersionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMApplicationVersionListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMBatchJobDefinitionListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists all the available batch job definitions based on the batch job resources uploaded during the application creation. The listed batch job definitions can then be used to start a batch job.

para.para: The identifier of the application.
If the batch job definition is a FileBatchJobDefinition, the prefix allows you to search on the file names of FileBatchJobDefinitions.
The maximum number of batch job definitions to return.
A pagination token returned from a previous call to this operation. This specifies the next item to return. To return to the beginning of the list, exclude this parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMBatchJobDefinitionListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'BatchJobDefinitions'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.ListBatchJobDefinitionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.ListBatchJobDefinitionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMBatchJobDefinitionListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ExecutionId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ExecutionId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMBatchJobExecutionListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists historical, current, and scheduled batch job executions for a specific application.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application.
The unique identifier of each batch job execution.
The name of each batch job execution.
The time after which the batch job executions started.
The time before the batch job executions started.
The status of the batch job executions.
The maximum number of batch job executions to return.
A pagination token to control the number of batch job executions displayed in the list.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMBatchJobExecutionListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'BatchJobExecutions'. Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.ListBatchJobExecutionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMDataSetListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists the data sets imported for a specific application. In Amazon Web Services Mainframe Modernization, data sets are associated with applications deployed on environments. This is known as importing data sets. Currently, Amazon Web Services Mainframe Modernization can import data sets into catalogs using CreateDataSetImportTask.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application for which you want to list the associated data sets.
The prefix of the data set name, which you can use to filter the list of data sets.
The maximum number of objects to return.
A pagination token returned from a previous call to this operation. This specifies the next item to return. To return to the beginning of the list, exclude this parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMDataSetListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DataSets'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.ListDataSetsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.ListDataSetsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.GetAMMDataSetListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMApplicationCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new application with given parameters. Requires an existing environment and application definition file.

para.para: The content of the application definition. This is a JSON object that contains the resource configuration/definitions that identify an application.
The description of the application.
The type of the target platform for this application.
The unique identifier of the application.
The S3 bucket that contains the application definition.
A list of tags to apply to the application.

Unique, case-sensitive identifier the service generates to ensure the idempotency of the request to create an application. The service generates the clientToken when the API call is triggered. The token expires after one hour, so if you retry the API within this timeframe with the same clientToken, you will get the same response. The service also handles deleting the clientToken after it expires.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMApplicationCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.CreateApplicationResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.CreateApplicationResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMApplicationCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMApplicationCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMDataSetImportTaskCmdlet
member.summary: Starts a data set import task for a specific application.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application for which you want to import data sets.
The data sets.
The Amazon S3 location of the data sets.

Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request to create a data set import. The service generates the clientToken when the API call is triggered. The token expires after one hour, so if you retry the API within this timeframe with the same clientToken, you will get the same response. The service also handles deleting the clientToken after it expires.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMDataSetImportTaskCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'TaskId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.CreateDataSetImportTaskResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.CreateDataSetImportTaskResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMDataSetImportTaskCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMDeploymentCmdlet
member.summary: Creates and starts a deployment to deploy an application into an environment.

para.para: The application identifier.
The version of the application to deploy.
The identifier of the environment where this application will be deployed.

Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request to create a deployment. The service generates the clientToken when the API call is triggered. The token expires after one hour, so if you retry the API within this timeframe with the same clientToken, you will get the same response. The service also handles deleting the clientToken after it expires.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMDeploymentCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DeploymentId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.CreateDeploymentResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.CreateDeploymentResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMEnvironmentCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a runtime environment for a given runtime engine.

para.para: The description of the environment.
The number of instances in a high availability configuration.
The engine type for the environment.
The version of the engine type for the environment.
The type of instance for the environment.
The unique identifier of the environment.
Configures a desired maintenance window for the environment. If you do not provide a value, a random system-generated value will be assigned.
Specifies whether the environment is publicly accessible.
The list of security groups for the VPC associated with this environment.
Optional. The storage configurations for this environment.
The list of subnets associated with the VPC for this environment.
The tags for the environment.

Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request to create an environment. The service generates the clientToken when the API call is triggered. The token expires after one hour, so if you retry the API within this timeframe with the same clientToken, you will get the same response. The service also handles deleting the clientToken after it expires.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMEnvironmentCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'EnvironmentId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.CreateEnvironmentResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.CreateEnvironmentResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the EngineType parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^EngineType' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.NewAMMEnvironmentCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.RemoveAMMApplicationFromEnvironmentCmdlet
member.summary: Deletes a specific application from a specified environment where it has been previously deployed. You cannot delete an environment using DeleteEnvironment, if any application has ever been deployed to it. This API removes the association of the application with the environment so you can delete the environment smoothly.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application you want to delete.
The unique identifier of the runtime environment where the application was previously deployed.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.RemoveAMMApplicationFromEnvironmentCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.DeleteApplicationFromEnvironmentResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.RemoveAMMApplicationFromEnvironmentCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.RemoveAMMApplicationFromEnvironmentCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.RemoveAMMEnvironmentCmdlet
member.summary: Deletes a specific environment. The environment cannot contain deployed applications. If it does, you must delete those applications before you delete the environment.

para.para: The unique identifier of the runtime environment you want to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.RemoveAMMEnvironmentCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.DeleteEnvironmentResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.RemoveAMMEnvironmentCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the EnvironmentId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^EnvironmentId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.RemoveAMMEnvironmentCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.RemoveAMMResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Removes one or more tags from the specified resource.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
The keys of the tags to remove.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StartAMMApplicationCmdlet
member.summary: Starts an application that is currently stopped.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application you want to start.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StartAMMApplicationCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.StartApplicationResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StartAMMBatchJobCmdlet
member.summary: Starts a batch job and returns the unique identifier of this execution of the batch job. The associated application must be running in order to start the batch job.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application associated with this batch job.
The file name for the batch job identifier.
The relative path to the file name for the batch job identifier.
The collection of batch job parameters. For details about limits for keys and values, see Coding variables in JCL.
The name of the script containing the batch job definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StartAMMBatchJobCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ExecutionId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.StartBatchJobResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.StartBatchJobResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StartAMMBatchJobCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StartAMMBatchJobCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StopAMMApplicationCmdlet
member.summary: Stops a running application.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application you want to stop.

Stopping an application process can take a long time. Setting this parameter to true lets you force stop the application so you don't need to wait until the process finishes to apply another action on the application. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StopAMMApplicationCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.StopApplicationResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StopAMMApplicationCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StopAMMApplicationCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StopAMMBatchJobExecutionCmdlet
member.summary: Cancels the running of a specific batch job execution.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application.
The unique identifier of the batch job execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.StopAMMBatchJobExecutionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.CancelBatchJobExecutionResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ExecutionId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ExecutionId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.UpdateAMMApplicationCmdlet
member.summary: Updates an application and creates a new version.

para.para: The unique identifier of the application you want to update.
The content of the application definition. This is a JSON object that contains the resource configuration/definitions that identify an application.
The current version of the application to update.
The description of the application to update.
The S3 bucket that contains the application definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.UpdateAMMApplicationCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ApplicationVersion'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.UpdateApplicationResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.UpdateApplicationResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.UpdateAMMApplicationCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.UpdateAMMApplicationCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.UpdateAMMEnvironmentCmdlet
member.summary: Updates the configuration details for a specific environment.

para.para: Indicates whether to update the environment during the maintenance window. The default is false. Currently, Amazon Web Services Mainframe Modernization accepts the engineVersion parameter only if applyDuringMaintenanceWindow is true. If any parameter other than engineVersion is provided in UpdateEnvironmentRequest, it will fail if applyDuringMaintenanceWindow is set to true.
The desired capacity for the environment to update.
The version of the runtime engine for the environment.
The unique identifier of the runtime environment that you want to update.
The instance type for the environment to update.
Configures a desired maintenance window for the environment. If you do not provide a value, a random system-generated value will be assigned.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.UpdateAMMEnvironmentCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'EnvironmentId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.UpdateEnvironmentResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MainframeModernization.Model.UpdateEnvironmentResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.UpdateAMMEnvironmentCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the EnvironmentId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^EnvironmentId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMM.UpdateAMMEnvironmentCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
